instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message:
Got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in today with no display. System chimes as normal but there is nothing on the internal screen. 

Visual inspection revealed some liquid damage on the JTAG connector which has been cleaned up, i've also cleaned the screen connection and tried another LCD - still no display. I'm not getting any voltage on L8300 so i'm guessing it might be a <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> issue but i cannot see any liquid around <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>? Is there anything else I need to check before replacing <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message:
5V MUST appear at pins 28-30 of J8300, at least in the few first seconds, when hear the chime.
<SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> should rise to 2.5V at same time.
If not, PCH cannot recognize the screen and 5V will disappear.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message: There is no 5v coming there at all not even for a few seconds. What is the next step?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message: Solved - in the end it was a bad <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> - once replaced, display backlight and image are back as normal.
